news.title: Mighty Warriors lose to Angola
news.content:
Story by Lawrence Trusida, Sport Editor
The Mighty Warriors have all to do in the reverse encounter of the Women’s Africa Cup of Nations qualifiers after going down 2-1 to Angola in the first leg played in Luanda this Thursday.
Zimbabwe started off the match on a bad note after conceding within the first minute following poor communication at the back.
The Mighty Warriors however did not rest on their laurels, as they sprang into action and started dominating play and knitting some good passes.
Their efforts were rewarded in the 25th minute after some good work on the flank from Ethel Chinyerere before she crossed for debutant Ruvimbo Mucherera who made no mistake tapping in from close range.

news.title: FC Platinum boosts squad ahead of new season
news.content:
Story by Courage Bushe
FORMER Premier Soccer League Champions, FC Platinum, have declared their readiness to wrestle back the league trophy after finalising their squad for the upcoming season.
Pure Platinum Play have failed to win any major trophy since sealing their fourth consecutive league trophy in 2022, a year they also won the Castle Challenge Cup.
After finishing second last season, FC Platinum feels they now have the pedigree to gun for the ultimate prize in the domestic game after the unveiling of seven new players, two technical team members and a new sponsorship deal.
“We have seen some positive changes in the last two seasons, and, we are optimistic that this sponsorship and new additions will add value to our squad. This year, we are leaving no stone unturned in our quest to win the championship and make an impact in the champions league,” FC Platinum chairperson, Dumisani Sisale said.
FC Platinum struggled for goals last season, but they hope the new Malawian duo, striker Nickson Nyasulu and attacking forward Vincent Nyangulu will be the tonic they need.
At the back, they leaked goals and have added defender Precious Phiri from Nyasa Big Bullets of Malawi, Thubelihle Jubane from Sheasham FC and Cory Black from Blanket Mine.
Midfielder James Nguluve has also joined from Green Fuel FC and forward Claivert Tshuma from relegated Hwange.

news.title: Mbappe can reach Ronaldo’s level, Ancelotti says
news.content:
Real Madrid manager Carlo Ancelotti heaped praise on his striker Kylian Mbappe after he scored a hat-trick in a 3-1 win over Manchester City on Wednesday that took the Champions League holders into the last 16.
Ancelotti said Mbappe had the potential to reach the same level as club great Cristiano Ronaldo, who is Real’s all-time leading scorer with 451 goals in 438 games for the 15-times Champions League winners.
“He has the quality to reach his numbers, but he has to work, because Cristiano set the bar very high, but he is so excited to play here, he can reach Cristiano’s level,” Ancelotti told a press conference.
“Everyone was waiting for this hat-trick from him and it has finally arrived. But Mbappe is not the only one, we have many players who make a difference. And they make a difference with their collective work above their individual quality which is remarkable.”
Mbappe, who scored 256 goals in 308 appearances over six years at Paris St Germain, said he did not care about being the top scorer if it did not lead to silverware.
“I was the Champions League’s top scorer last year, but did I win it? No,” Mbappe told reporters.
“I don’t care about being the leading scorer, in my career, I have scored many goals. If with these goals we win titles I will sign with my blood. If I can score 50, all the better, but all I want is to win titles,” he added.
NEXT OPPONENTSAncelotti lamented that his side had to go through the pain of the knockout round but said that they were to blame after a slow start to the campaign that caused them to finish outside the top eight in the league standings.
The holders will face Bayer Leverkusen or city rivals Atletico Madrid, depending on Friday’s draw, as they seek a record-extending 16th title.
“It’s not positive at all having to go through the knock-out because we had to play 10 games to get to the last 16,” Ancelotti said.

news.title: Mighty Warriors gear up for crunch tie against Angola
news.content:
Story by Anashe Murombedzi, Sports Reporter
The Zimbabwe senior women’s football team, the Mighty Warriors are set to face hosts Angola in the first leg of the 2026 CAF Women’s Africa Cup of Nations Qualifier this Thursday.
The team has been fine-tuning their skills having held a two-day training session in the Angolan capital, Luanda.
The Mighty Warriors will be looking to get past the hosts they have had difficulties overcoming after so many close battles.
In a rallying cry to the nation, Australia-based Mighty Warriors striker Yolanda Kanyai has rallied fans to come out in numbers and support the team as they take on Angola.

news.title: Mighty Warriors begin training ahead of Angola clash
news.content:
Story by Anashe Murombedzi, Sports Reporter
The Zimbabwe senior women’s football team, the Mighty Warriors, who are now in Angola, ahead of their Thursday CAF Women’s Africa Cup of Nations 2026 Qualifier against the hosts, began their two-day training this Tuesday.
The team, which departed Harare this Monday, began their two-day training session in the Angolan capital this Tuesday, fine-tuning their skills and strategies ahead of the crucial encounter set for Thursday.
The squad has been bolstered by the arrival of Australia-based forward Yolanda Kanyai, Israeli-based and Mighty Warriors captain Emmaculate Msipa and midfielder Danai Bhobho.
A win against Angola on Thursday at the Estadio Joaquim Dinis will see the Mighty Warriors advance to the second round of the qualifiers, where they will face the winner between Malawi and Congo.
